covid19 0.0.0.9000
  • Reference
    • Exploring COVID-19 Quarantine Breach

COVID-19 Quarantine Breach Dataset

covid19.Rd

Simulated outcomes of quarantine breach events under different scenarios of basic reproductive ratio (R0) and vaccine efficacy (VE). Used to explore how the relative force of infection changes with R0 and VE.

Usage

covid19

Format

A data frame with 100 rows and 3 columns:

R0

integer, basic reproductive ratio: the average number of secondary infections produced by an infected person in a completely susceptible population.

VE

numeric, vaccine efficacy, representing reduction in susceptibility to infection.

Value

numeric, relative force of infection produced by quarantine breaches.

Source

Zachreson, C., Shearer, F. M., Price, D. J., Lydeamore, M. J., McVernon, J., McCaw, J., & Geard, N. (2022). COVID‑19 in low-tolerance border quarantine systems: Impact of the Delta variant of SARS‑CoV‑2. Science Advances, 8(14), eabm3624. https://doi.org/10.1126/sciadv.abm3624

Details

This dataset is based on Figure 3 of Zachreson et al. (2022), which demonstrates how the relative force of infection from quarantine breaches scales with vaccine efficacy (VE) and the basic reproductive ratio of the virus (R0).

  • Blue dotted box: baseline scenario (R0 = 3, VE = 0), consistent with pre-Delta outbreak data.

  • Green dotted box: vaccinated quarantine pathways before Delta.

  • Yellow dashed box: plausible scenarios for Delta variant.

Examples

# View the first rows
head(covid19)
#>   R0  Value  VE
#> 1  1 0.0170 0.9
#> 2  1 0.0167 0.8
#> 3  1 0.0370 0.7
#> 4  1 0.0402 0.6
#> 5  1 0.0607 0.5
#> 6  1 0.0972 0.4

# Plot heatmap (using helper function from package)
if(require(ggplot2)) {
  plot_covid("All")
}
#> Loading required package: ggplot2
#> Error in plot_covid("All"): could not find function "plot_covid"

# Plot line plot for a specific R0
plot_covid(3)
#> Error in plot_covid(3): could not find function "plot_covid"
